subject: Re: New member: Read_Alphabet
msgSnippet: Robert and Bob, The distinguishing feature of Pitman shorthand was that it was phonemic.  Earlier shorthands were letter based. Pitman does reduce the number
messageBody:
Robert and Bob,

The distinguishing feature of Pitman shorthand was that it was
phonemic. Earlier shorthands were letter based.

Pitman does reduce the number of vowels to a minimum and introduces
abbreviations which less than phonemic. The difference between a
voiced and unvoiced consonant was the pressure on the pencil. The
shapes for b and p were the same, one was just darker.

Regards, Steve


--- Robert McBroom <info@o...> wrote:
> Pitman, as I understand it, is not a phoneme-based shorthand, but
> merely a means of taking dictation,

Robert and Bob,

The distinguishing feature of Pitman shorthand was that it was 
phonemic.  Earlier shorthands were letter based.

Pitman does reduce the number of vowels to a minimum and introduces 
abbreviations which less than phonemic.  The difference between a 
voiced and unvoiced consonant was the pressure on the pencil.  The 
shapes for b and p were the same, one was just darker.

Regards,  Steve

> Pitman, as I understand it, is not a phoneme-based shorthand, but 
> merely a means of taking dictation,
